[[File:Vu Bui in Minecraft Monthly.png|thumb|[[Vu Bui]] in the first episode of ''Minecraft Monthly'', featuring the old logo.]]'''''Minecraft Monthly''''' is a series of normally monthly news videos hosted by [[Vu Bui]], aimed at giving a comedic rundown of recent and upcoming features regarding the [[Minecraft (franchise)|''Minecraft'']] franchise.<ref name="monthly-one">{{Ytl|jQ58UEXrFzs|1.20 NAME REVEAL and more... &vert; MINECRAFT MONTHLY|Minecraft|March 2, 2023}}</ref> It is the successor of the livestream series ''[[Minecraft Now]]''.

== List of episodes ==
The official playlist of ''Minecraft Monthly'' episodes can be found [https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLZHdY_46KnYvl_EPTaV9iSOyAGVBX28uV here].

* Recapped the latest [[Bundles of Bravery]] Drop features.

| December 4<ref>{{Ytl|u63KYFsNC44|NEWEST GAME DROP! + LIVE EVENT IN MINECRAFT? &vert; MINECRAFT MONTHLY|Minecraft|December 4, 2024}}</ref>
| [[File:Minecraft Monthly 16.jpg|frameless]]
|
* Recapped the release of the [[The Garden Awakens]] drop for both [[Java Edition|Java]] and [[Bedrock Edition|Bedrock]] editions.
* Introduced features of the new [[pale garden]] biome, including the hostile mob "[[creaking]]" and ambient elements like glowing [[eyeblossom]] particles.
* Announced upcoming [https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/marketplace/pdp?id=500dbac8-209a-4a55-9643-829fd6f8989f Ghost Pets], [https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/marketplace/pdp?id=616f1797-24ec-4794-bbe4-c08b77172c6d Majestic Camping] and [https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/marketplace/pdp?id=c8e87848-aae0-4b66-bc0d-6c70294a93e0 Phantom Frames] [[add-on]]s and community challenges tied to the drop, with unique rewards like the creak [[emote]] and creaking mask in Bedrock and [[skin]]s in Java.
* Revealed the upcoming [https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/article/avatar-rites-of-passage-dlc Avatar Rites of Passage DLC] on [[Minecraft Marketplace]], allowing players to explore the world of [[w:Fictional universe of Avatar#Pandora|Pandora]] from [[w:Avatar (Franchise)|Avatar]].
* Introduced a new [[achievement]] called "Heart Transplant" with related [[character creator]] rewards.
* Announced a mysterious live event called the [[Eerie Mojang Office Party]], set in a fantasy version of the [[Mojang Studios]] office, running from December 9th to December 20th on Bedrock Edition.
|-
|December 30<ref>{{Ytl|2bZ6-_aQHg0|THANK YOU FOR AN AMAZING 2024&vert;MINECRAFT MONTHLY|Minecraft|December 30, 2024}}</ref>
| [[File:Minecraft Monthly 17.jpg|frameless]]
|
* Recapped the release of the [[Armored Paws]] drop, which included nine new [[wolf variants]], [[wolf armor]], and [[armadillo]]s. Armadillos drop [[Armadillo scute|scutes]] when brushed, and wolf armor protects wolves from damage as long as the armor is intact.
* Highlighted the [[Tricky Trials]] update featuring challenging [[trial chambers]], a gusty hostile mob called the [[breeze]], the introduction of the [[mace]], and the [[wind charge]] for parkour.
* Celebrated the launch of [[Marketplace Pass]] and notable DLCs, including [https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/article/avatar-rites-of-passage-dlc Avatar: Rites of Passage DLC], [https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/article/moana-sails-into-minecraft Moana 2 DLC], [https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/article/transformers-dlc The Transformers DLC], [https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/article/kung-fu-panda-dlc Kung Fu Panda DLC], [https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/article/the-tetris-dlc-on-rotation Tetris DLC], and [https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/article/spongebob-dlc-arrives-minecraft SpongeBob SquarePants DLC].
* Announced that instead of a single annual update, multiple [[game drop]]s will now be released throughout the year, with two [[Minecraft Live]] events planned for 2025.
* Mentioned the release of the [https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/article/free-nasa-dlc James Webb Space Telescope Challenge DLC] with [[W:NASA|NASA]] and [https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/article/planet-earth-iii-perspectives Planet Earth III] in Minecraft Education and Marketplace, teaching about the cosmos and the natural world.
* Introduced the [[Bundles of Bravery]] drop, which added [[bundles]] for easier item storage and gifting, and brought [[Hardcore Mode]] to Minecraft [[Bedrock Edition]].
* Announced the first-ever immersive experience, [[Villager Rescue]], currently in Dallas, Texas, with plans to expand to other cities.
* Introduced [[The Garden Awakens]] drop featuring the [[pale garden]] biome, [[pale oak]] trees, [[pale hanging moss]], [[eyeblossom]]s, and the hostile mob [[creaking]].
* Celebrated [[15 Days of Minecraft|Minecraft's 15th birthday]], thanking the community for their support and creativity.
|}

=== 2025 ===
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! Airing on
! Thumbnail
! Notes
|-
| January 29<ref>{{Ytl|335cz7AhBFY|NEW MOB VARIANTS + BUSHY NEWS &vert; MINECRAFT MONTHLY|Minecraft|January 29, 2025}}</ref>
| [[File:Minecraft Monthly 18.jpg|frameless]]
|
* Introduced two new [[pig variant]]: one for warm biomes and one for cold biomes.
* Added new ambient feature: [[Particles (Java Edition)|falling leaf particles]] in the [[Overworld]], matching the tree colors they fall from.
* Introduced [[leaf litter]], which can be used for decoration, in furnaces, or to enjoy rustling sounds.
* Added [[wildflowers]], which grow in four stages, can be placed at various angles, and are found in [[meadow]]s and [[birch forest]]s.
* Announced a time capsule to celebrate Minecraft's 15th anniversary, with players voting on what to include.
* Highlighted the [https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/article/the-minecraft-national-park National Park map] in [[Minecraft Marketplace]], with proceeds supporting the Nature Conservancy. Available until January 31st.
* [[Lodestone]] blocks now appear in [[ruined portal]]s and have a new [[crafting recipe]] using [[iron ingot]] and [[chiseled stone bricks]].
* Added new sounds for iron-related blocks such as [[doors]], [[trapdoors]], and [[pressure plates]].
* Revealed [https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/article/hello-kitty-and-friends-dlc Hello Kitty DLC], allowing players to create a cozy farm with Sanrio characters like Hello Kitty, Cinnamoroll, and Kuromi.
* Announced two new [[cow variant]], one for cold biomes and one for warm biomes.
* Introduced [[firefly bush]]es, which emit firefly particles and add ambient atmosphere to the game.
* All new features, including cow variants and firefly bushes, are available for players to try now.
|-
| February 19<ref>{{Ytl|0OhUrjGkHso|EGG-CITING NEWS AND MORE! &vert; MINECRAFT MONTHLY|Minecraft|February 19, 2025}}</ref>
| [[File:Minecraft Monthly 19.jpg|frameless]]
|
* Showcased new [[cow]] variants, which are part of the upcoming game drop and available for testing in [[Beta|''Bedrock'' Beta]]/[[Preview]] and [[Snapshot|''Java'' Snapshot]].
* Showcased new [[chicken]] variants with distinct colors and unique [[egg]]s.
* Recapped the [[Pig|warm]] and [[Pig|cold pig]] variants revealed earlier.
* Mentioned the updated sheep spawning mechanics, where different colored sheep now spawn in specific biomes according to its temperature.
* Mentioned the expanded [[wandering trader]] [[trades]] with new items and lower prices.
* Announced new [[cartographer]] [[map]]s which can be bought from the [[cartographer]].
* Announced [[Dungeons & Dragons: A New Quest DLC]], returning players to familiar heroes and locations like Icewind Dale, coming soon to [[Minecraft Marketplace]].
* Showcased improvements to the [[firefly bush]], with new [[ambient sounds]].
* Showcased new [[ambient sounds]] added to [[desert]] and [[badlands]] biomes.
* Revealed new desert plants: [[cactus flower]], [[short dry grass]] and [[tall dry grass]].
* Showcased falling [[leaves]] [[particles]] and [[wildflower]]s as new decorative and ambient features.
* Showcased improved leaf litter, which now changes color based on biome.
* Announced seven new [[wolf]] [[sound]]s. 
* Highlighted the [[CyberSafe: AI DLC]] for [[Minecraft Education]], celebrating Safer Internet Day with lessons on AI, 3D design, and digital citizenship.
* Revealed new [[spawn egg]] textures, making each egg visually match the [[mob]] it spawns.
|-
